intro: Barleria stellatotomentosa var. ukambensis, commonly known as the Kenyan barleria, is a perennial herb native to East Africa. It features slender, branched stems covered in dense, star-shaped hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in clusters, typically in shades of pink or purple, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine, woolly coating. This species is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy plant in regions with low rainfall.
